title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
author: The classic.
introduction: This is the 'famous' $250 Neiman Marcus chocolate chip cookie recipe. I have yet to find another recipe that I love as much and that turns out so consistently amazing. I often make them without the grated chocoalte bar and nuts, and they are just as good! I think the blended oatmeal in these is what gives them such a great texture and flavor.

instructions: 2. Cream together butter and both sugars. Stir in eggs and vanilla.

3.Finely grind oatmeal in a blender or food processor. Combine the oatmeal, flour, salt, baking powder and soda in a medium bowl, and slowly add it to the wet ingredients. Beat just until combined. Grate chocolate bar using a microplane grater and add it, along with chocolate chips and nuts to the batter. Mix just to combine.
4. Drop by heaping tablespoonfuls, 2 inches apart, on a greased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 minutes.
notes: These turn out even better if you allow the dough to rest a couple hours up to overnight.
